t: John 8
The Adulterous Woman
But*p Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
Early in the morning He came again into the temple, and all the people were coming to Him; and He sat down and began*i to teach them.
The scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman caught in adultery, and having set her in the center of*i the*i court,*i
they said to Him, “Teacher, this woman has been caught in adultery, in the very act.
Now in the Law Moses commanded us to stone such women; what then do You say?”
They were saying this, testing Him, so that they might have grounds for accusing Him. But Jesus stooped down and with His finger wrote on the ground.
But when they persisted in asking Him, He straightened up, and said to them, “He*r who*r is*r without*r sin*r among*r you,*r let*r him*r be*ir the*ir first*r to*r throw*r a*r stone*r at*r her.”*r
Again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
When they heard it, they began*i to go out one by one, beginning with the older ones, and He was left alone, and the woman, where she was, in the center of*i the*i court.*i
Straightening up, Jesus said to her, “Woman,*r where*r are*r they?*r Did*r no*r one*r condemn*r you?”*r
She said, “No one, Lord.” And Jesus said, “I*r do*r not*r condemn*r you,*r either.*r Go.*r From*r now*r on*r sin*r no*r more.”]*r
Jesus Is the Light of the World

Then*p Jesus again spoke to them, saying, “I*r am*r the*r Light*r of*r the*r world;*r he*r who*r follows*r Me*r will*r not*r walk*r in*r the*r darkness,*r but*r will*r have*r the*r Light*r of*r life.”*r
So the Pharisees said to Him, “You are testifying about Yourself; Your testimony is not true.”

Jesus answered and said to them, “Even*r if*r I*r testify*r about*r Myself,*r My*r testimony*r is*r true,*r for*r I*r know*r where*r I*r came*r from*r and*r where*r I*r am*r going;*r but*r you*r do*r not*r know*r where*r I*r come*r from*r or*r where*r I*r am*r going.*r
You*r judge*r according*r to*r the*r flesh;*r I*r am*r not*r judging*r anyone.*r
But*r even*r if*r I*r do*r judge,*r My*r judgment*r is*r true;*r for*r I*r am*r not*r alone*r in*ir it,*ir but*r I*r and*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r Me.*r
Even*r in*r your*r law*r it*r has*r been*r written*r that*r the*r testimony*r of*r two*r men*r is*r true.*r
I*r am*r He*r who*r testifies*r about*r Myself,*r and*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r Me*r testifies*r about*r Me.”*r
So they were saying to Him, “Where is Your Father?” Jesus answered, “You*r know*r neither*r Me*r nor*r My*r Father;*r if*r you*r knew*r Me,*r you*r would*r know*r My*r Father*r also.”*r
These words He spoke in the treasury, as He taught in the temple; and no one seized Him, because His hour had not yet come.
Then*p He said again to them, “I*r go*r away,*r and*r you*r will*r seek*r Me,*r and*r will*r die*r in*r your*r sin;*r where*r I*r am*r going,*r you*r cannot*r come.”*r
So the Jews were saying, “Surely He will not kill Himself, will He, since He says, ‘Where*r I*r am*r going,*r you*r cannot*r come’?”*r
And He was saying to them, “You*r are*r from*r below,*r I*r am*r from*r above;*r you*r are*r of*r this*r world,*r I*r am*r not*r of*r this*r world.*r
Therefore*r I*r said*r to*r you*r that*r you*r will*r die*r in*r your*r sins;*r for*r unless*r you*r believe*r that*r I*r am*r He,*ir you*r will*r die*r in*r your*r sins.”*r
So they were saying to Him, “Who are You?” Jesus said to them, “What*r have*r I*r been*r saying*r to*r you*r from*ir the*r beginning?*r

I*r have*r many*r things*r to*r speak*r and*r to*r judge*r concerning*r you,*r but*r He*r who*r sent*r Me*r is*r true;*r and*r the*r things*r which*r I*r heard*r from*r Him,*r these*r I*r speak*r to*r the*r world.”*r
They did not realize that He had been speaking to them about the Father.

So Jesus said, “When*r you*r lift*r up*r the*r Son*r of*r Man,*r then*r you*r will*r know*r that*r I*r am*r He,*ir and*r I*r do*r nothing*r on*r My*r own*r initiative,*r but*r I*r speak*r these*r things*r as*r the*r Father*r taught*r Me.*r
And*r He*r who*r sent*r Me*r is*r with*r Me;*r He*r has*r not*r left*r Me*r alone,*r for*r I*r always*r do*r the*r things*r that*r are*r pleasing*r to*r Him.”*r
As He spoke these things, many came to believe in Him.
The Truth Will Make You Free
So*p Jesus was saying to those Jews who had believed Him, “If*r you*r continue*r in*r My*r word,*r then*ir you*r are*r truly*r disciples*r of*r Mine;*r
and*r you*r will*r know*r the*r truth,*r and*r the*r truth*r will*r make*r you*r free.”*r
They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s descendants and have never yet been enslaved to anyone; how is it that You say, ‘You*r will*r become*r free’?”*r
Jesus*p answered them, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r everyone*r who*r commits*r sin*r is*r the*r slave*r of*r sin.*r
The*r slave*r does*r not*r remain*r in*r the*r house*r forever;*r the*r son*r does*r remain*r forever.*r
So*r if*r the*r Son*r makes*r you*r free,*r you*r will*r be*r free*r indeed.*r
I*r know*r that*r you*r are*r Abraham’s*r descendants;*r yet*r you*r seek*r to*r kill*r Me,*r because*r My*r word*r has*r no*r place*r in*r you.*r
I*r speak*r the*r things*r which*r I*r have*r seen*r with*r My*ir Father;*r therefore*r you*r also*r do*r the*r things*r which*r you*r heard*r from*r your*ir father.”*r
They*p answered and said to Him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said to them, “If*r you*r are*r Abraham’s*r children,*r do*r the*r deeds*r of*r Abraham.*r
But*r as*r it*r is,*r you*r are*r seeking*r to*r kill*r Me,*r a*r man*r who*r has*r told*r you*r the*r truth,*r which*r I*r heard*r from*r God;*r this*r Abraham*r did*r not*r do.*r
You*r are*r doing*r the*r deeds*r of*r your*r father.”*r They said to Him, “We were not born of fornication; we have one Father: God.”

Jesus said to them, “If*r God*r were*r your*r Father,*r you*r would*r love*r Me,*r for*r I*r proceeded*r forth*r and*r have*r come*r from*r God,*r for*r I*r have*r not*r even*r come*r on*r My*r own*r initiative,*r but*r He*r sent*r Me.*r
Why*r do*r you*r not*r understand*r what*r I*r am*r saying?*r It*ir is*ir because*r you*r cannot*r hear*r My*r word.*r

You*r are*r of*r your*ir father*r the*r devil,*r and*r you*r want*r to*r do*r the*r desires*r of*r your*r father.*r He*r was*r a*r murderer*r from*r the*r beginning,*r and*r does*r not*r stand*r in*r the*r truth*r because*r there*r is*r no*r truth*r in*r him.*r Whenever*r he*r speaks*r a*r lie,*r he*r speaks*r from*r his*r own*r nature,*ir for*r he*r is*r a*r liar*r and*r the*r father*r of*r lies.*r
But*r because*r I*r speak*r the*r truth,*r you*r do*r not*r believe*r Me.*r
Which*r one*r of*r you*r convicts*r Me*r of*r sin?*r If*r I*r speak*r truth,*r why*r do*r you*r not*r believe*r Me?*r
He*r who*r is*r of*r God*r hears*r the*r words*r of*r God;*r for*r this*r reason*r you*r do*r not*r hear*r them,*ir because*r you*r are*r not*r of*r God.”*r
The*p Jews answered and said to Him, “Do we not say rightly that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”
Jesus answered, “I*r do*r not*r have*r a*r demon;*r but*r I*r honor*r My*r Father,*r and*r you*r dishonor*r Me.*r
But*r I*r do*r not*r seek*r My*r glory;*r there*r is*r One*r who*r seeks*r and*r judges.*r
Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r if*r anyone*r keeps*r My*r word*r he*r will*r never*r see*r death.”*r
The Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a demon. Abraham died, and the prophets also;*i and You say, ‘If*r anyone*r keeps*r My*r word,*r he*r will*r never*r taste*r of*r death.’*r
Surely You are not greater than our father Abraham, who died? The prophets died too; whom do You make Yourself out to*i be?”*i
Jesus answered, “If*r I*r glorify*r Myself,*r My*r glory*r is*r nothing;*r it*r is*r My*r Father*r who*r glorifies*r Me,*r of*r whom*r you*r say,*r ‘He*r is*r our*r God’;*r

and*r you*r have*r not*r come*r to*r know*r Him,*r but*r I*r know*r Him;*r and*r if*r I*r say*r that*r I*r do*r not*r know*r Him,*r I*r will*r be*r a*r liar*r like*r you,*r but*r I*r do*r know*r Him*r and*r keep*r His*r word.*r
Your*r father*r Abraham*r rejoiced*r to*r see*r My*r day,*r and*r he*r saw*r it*ir and*r was*r glad.”*r
So the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have You seen Abraham?”
Jesus said to them, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r before*r Abraham*r was*r born,*r I*r am.”*r
Therefore they picked up stones to throw at Him, but Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple.
